patterns: differentiate between rabi and kharif crops
differentiate between kharif and rabi crops
what are kharif and rabi crops
responses: Kharif crops: are dependent on the monsoon, and their cropping season runs from July to October. Whereas Rabi crops: are sown in the winter after the monsoon rains are over and harvested in the summer
Rabi crops are grown in the winter season whereas the Kharif crops are grown in the monsoon season.
Rabi crops, including wheat and barley, are sown during the winter months. In contrast, kharif crops like rice and maize are planted with the arrival of the monsoon in June
